subject: Re: Suggestions for electronics tutorials?
author: Misty
full_text:
Hmmm I think perhaps if you type those keywords into 
google "electronics" "tutorials" you may find some of what you seek. 
There are a few places online that have tutorials posted and also on 
youtube they have step by step tutorials with video showing how they 
are doing it. 

http://www.electronics-tutorials.com/ seems to offer a few insights as 
well as diagrams etcetera into the basics of building some peices of 
equipment. There are also alot of BIY projects (build it yourself).

Misty

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "ourobouros2k2" <ourobouros2k2@...> 
wrote:
>
> I was wondering if anyone knew of any good online electronics 
tutorials 
> (schematics, building, etc...). Once upon a time I used to know how 
to 
> read circuit schematics being a ham radio operator, but that was a 
very 
> long time ago. I would certainly like to refresh my knowledge and 
> attempt completion of my own projects based on some of the schematics 
> here. Modifying existing devices comes easy for me, but starting from 
> scratch leaves me scratching my head...
> 
> thanks in advance
> Andy
>
